body_html:
Between my previous message and this one, I pip installed pyamg, which upgraded scipy and numpy. This upgrade gave a huge overall performance boost to scipy. Now SVD runs in 40.56 seconds and use all 8 cores. It now runs on OpenBLAS. I guess that before that, I was using the system-wide installation of numpy and scipy which I think uses CBLAS.

You're right, SVD produce the eigenvectors they were just not in the same order as eigh or self_adjoint_eig.
body_text:
Between my previous message and this one, I pip installed pyamg, which upgraded scipy and numpy. This upgrade gave a huge overall performance boost to scipy. Now SVD runs in 40.56 seconds and use all 8 cores. It now runs on OpenBLAS. I guess that before that, I was using the system-wide installation of numpy and scipy which I think uses CBLAS.
You're right, SVD produce the eigenvectors they were just not in the same order as eigh or self_adjoint_eig.
body:
Between my previous message and this one, I pip installed `pyamg`, which upgraded `scipy` and `numpy`. This upgrade gave a huge overall performance boost to scipy. Now SVD runs in 40.56 seconds and use all 8 cores. It now runs on OpenBLAS. I guess that before that, I was using the system-wide installation of numpy and scipy which I think uses CBLAS.

You're right, SVD produce the eigenvectors they were just not in the same order as `eigh` or `self_adjoint_eig`.
